children.subject: I can't give a precise answer but anecdotally: I took the class a couple years ago and was a TA in 2018 and can't remember a single instance Math 53 or 54 was directly needed (I also never took 53). Maybe 54 just for solving systems of equations, but as you said, you should have covered that in the 16 series. Definitely a bit of probability is used (as also mentioned in the pre-reqs) but 70 (or Prob 140, etc)  should be more than enough for that.

history.content:
The official prereqs (listed in the course catalog per what the CS faculty proposed to the Academic Senate) are 61B and 162.

Even with the language shared on the class website "or" by definition isn't strict -- it suggests math 53 without math 54 would be fine. Since current versions of 16AB also assume (without it ever being made official) significant mastery of the math courses listed above, I'd imagine you should be fine. I'd also defer to Vivien's experience referred to below.
As a current TA for the course, you really only need 61A/B. Math 53/54 have no relevance whatsoever to the course content.

children.subject:
Currently taking the course, and I think the only class you need is 61A (the projects are pretty basic in Python). The rest of the course is thinking about the internet from a more abstract/design level and there's next to 0 math.

On a side note, this is my favorite course at Berkeley. It really makes you think about the architecture instead of just memorizing things!

history.content:
On the CS168 website it says that 61A/B and Math 53 or 54 is a pre-req

Ref:http://cs168.io/about.html

I'm a bit confused, is Math 54 "or" Math 54 a strict pre req to do well in this class. I will have taken EE16A/B which covers some of those concepts but wanted to double check. 

Thanks!
history.subject: CS168 Pre-Reqs
